dungeon.model.items
Class Item

java.lang.Object
  dungeon.model.items.Item
All Implemented Interfaces:
Persistent
Direct Known Subclasses:
Mob, Treasure
public abstract class Item
extends Object
implements Persistent

An item in the dungeon
Derived classes are:

  • Mob (for mobile items such as creatures)
  • Treasure (for collectable treasure items)

public abstract void draw(Graphics2D g,
                          Rectangle2D rect,
                          boolean highlight)
Draws the item to the screen

Parameters:
g - The graphics object
rect - The area the item occupies
highlight - Whether the item should be highlighted

onTick

public abstract void onTick(Game game)
This method is called on every game tick
Treasure items usually ignore this, but mobs use it to interact with the world

Parameters:
game - The current game state

placeAt

public boolean placeAt(Point2D location,
                       Game game)
Attempt to place the item at a given location on the map
Note: This method checks for collisions

Parameters:
location - The map location
game - The game state
Returns:
Returns true if the item was placed on the map; false otherwise
